item.title: Web UI Developer (san bruno)
item.description:
Qumu (koo-moo) provides enterprise software solutions to enable organizations to easily capture, manage, publish and distribute live and on-demand video content while leveraging existing IT infrastructure. Large organizations today are increasingly using video to communicate, teach, market and to be more competitive. Companies are spending a tremendous amount of time and money on expensive production equipment with the goal of providing high quality, reliable video presentations that scale to large international audiences. However, these efforts and investments often do not meet ROI goals because there is no underlying system to manage the events, content and resources to simplify the production and to reliably search, access, secure and distribute over the companys existing infrastructure. To meet these needs, Qumus software solutions provide video network and asset management, and media access services that deliver the following benefits:

 Manage thousands of video assets and easily categorize and store them for search and use in video programs
 Scale live video streams and video-on-demand to an enterprise audience across global corporate networks
 Centrally manage and dynamically publish to any number of third party portals or web properties for audience viewing
 Connect video infrastructure components on the network for central management and control
 Make video programs easy to use for an internationally distributed audience with any level of video experience

Qumu is seeking an experienced and creative UI developer to fulfill a technical lead role in the User Experience team. In this role, you will act as both a UI engineer and web designer of Qumu products and take advantage of your expertise to deliver engaging and dynamic web user experiences

Responsibilities:

* Design and develop User Interfaces for complex web applications including the design and implementation of web page templates and macros.

* Define the UI design and user interactions for new and existing Qumu products and features.

* Develop early high-level or detailed prototypes to effectively communicate design ideas and user interactions

* Employ your skills with the latest dynamic web 2.0 technologies (AJAX) to develop engaging, dynamic user experiences

* Work with video and web technologies including video capture, encoding, delivery and viewer presentation of video and other digital content

Requirements:

* Knowledge in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, JSP, XML/XHTML and thorough understanding and experience in building dynamic web UI technology utilizing AJAX components based on Dojo, YUI, Adobe Flash/Flex

* Demonstrated experience in all phases of web application development from initial concept and product requirements to design, development, testing and release deployment

* Strong, clean visual design sense

* Excellent leadership, communication and teamwork skills

* Expertise or working knowledge of video formats (Windows Media, MPEG, Flash), players and streaming technology is preferred.


Qumu is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, age, national origin, religion, physical or mental disability/handicap, marital status, veteran status, sexual orientation or any other basis prohibited by law.

Please email you cover letter and resume in confidence to resumes@qumu.com. Please include Web UI Engineer in the subject line of your submission.
